website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Compute Stick is a full Windows PC that fits in the palm of your hand and can be used with any HDMI-equipped display. It's $150, easy to set up, and is the most portable computer you can buy.
pros: As small and light as a candy bar
Plugs directly into an HDMI port in a monitor or HDTV
cons: Incompatible with some USB 3.0 hard drives
Need a USB mouse to initially set up Bluetooth devices
Requires included HDMI extension cable in tight quarters

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a good idea at the time to buy it, but stopped working after a month of usage. The blue light comes on and nothing on the screen. As a techie, it is impossible to try and find out why as you cannot connect a screen to it to find out why. I will stay clear!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great for TV dashboards
customer_reviews.text: Have 4 of these to run TV dashboards in our office (running 4k monitors). They work great. Mouse without Borders makes it easy to manage with one keyboard/mouse and we've got a webcam hooked up to one as well. Glad to have found this after numerous attempts to get a system working with Raspberry Pis and chromebits failed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Padfield

customer_reviews.title: Very slow for video
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough for Flash based video unfortunately - meaning couldn’t use for reason purchased. Very slow hardware
customer_reviews.author: IT has the answer

customer_reviews.title: running 24/7 for 10 months without problems
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am deducting one star is because I had to do some manual updates on the wifi driver (took some time to research as well) to solve the issue of very slow speeds over wifi. Otherwise I am very happy with this purchase. I bought this for digital signage and it has been running 24/7 for 10 months now. .
customer_reviews.author: Peter Brown

customer_reviews.title: Really slow
customer_reviews.text: Lacking in power. Fire stick much better for media etc
customer_reviews.author: LetsShop99

customer_reviews.title: Best of this type
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of kit at this price point. Sometimes struggles to start.
customer_reviews.author: Deiniol Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for everyday tasks
customer_reviews.text: Only use the stick to drive a monitor for browsing the web and displaying sheet music, so no real demands placed on the processor. But it does all I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING STICK :)
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stick ! I love it. I am using this stick as my computer using my TV screen. I bought Microsoft all-in-one wifeless keyboard together with this Intel stick. Working perfect as my personal computer. Those who are in quest of browsing the net on TV are recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nabin Rijal

customer_reviews.title: Very good PC solution
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly good and has been used as a general operators workstation with out any issues.
customer_reviews.author: DarmoBar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little computer, does exactly what it says on the box, neat,compact and surprisingly quick, make sure you add a micro SD card and its even better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor install of windows 10
customer_reviews.text: intel graphics driver aint happening , poor install of windows 10 , fail to set up still fighting with it
customer_reviews.author: tankblaster2k

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just had a duff one but not good!
customer_reviews.text: Had it only a week and the display port doesnt work on it anymore. Only inserted into one TV and within a week it now doesnt turn on :( Now tried it in different screens and still no luck... Maybe I just had a duff one but not good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected to home wifi network, other devices ...
customer_reviews.text: Won't stay connected to home wifi network, other devices, including devices running Window 10, Android, iPad, iPhone, Ubuntu do not have this problem. Intel Support was also awful. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C.

customer_reviews.title: ... ram used before you even run anything else - Poor WiFi speed
customer_reviews.text: Cons - 60% of ram used before you even run anything else - Poor WiFi speed, even with a WiFi dongle
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Seller! Great communication
customer_reviews.text: Fast Shipping.Item as described. Excellent Seller! Great communication! Recommend A++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Mihály Marosy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old laptop for an elderly couple (I like to help neighbors with computers and work in IT). For the price and considering the features and speed, and the fact that WIndows 10 is included, it can't be beat for value. Combined it with a cheap Logitech wireless keyboard/mouse combo and had it up and running very quickly. Consider this for elderly people who can use computers and who may benefit from using it on a big TV screen, as opposed to a smaller computer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great for cable cutters!! Great option for small screen on desktop computer!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited with this Intel Compute stick. So much easier to set up than a computer, and much cheaper. Instead of several hundred or thousand dollars, I purchased this, a wireless keyboard/mouse, and external hard drive. Attached to my large screen TV, I can sit on the couch and surf the net with ease. A great option for us folks getting older and having trouble seeing small print. Also, since my smart TV will not get updates or play some online TV shows in the browser, this will! I have worked in IT for 20 years, and been a researcher for longer, and this hits it out of the park on so many levels!
customer_reviews.author: Karen D

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you have a Vizio TV
customer_reviews.text: We use an earlier version of this model at work with a Samsung TV, so I bought the newer model to use at home with a Vizio 42" I happened to have laying around. Well, it doesn't work with it. Intel was notified of the problem in 2015 and they still haven't fixed it. The stick turns on and starts but immediately crashes with a blue screen. It may be a good device, I wouldn't know. I wouldn't buy this thing if you have a Vizio TV.
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: One of my best PC related purchases of my life
customer_reviews.text: One of my best PC related purchases of my life. Rocking it on my living room TV, paired with a "Mini Wireless Keyboard With Air Remote Mouse Combo 2.4GHz , Mouse Touchpad Combo, Best For Android tv box,HTPC,IPTV,PC,Raspberry pi 3,Pad and More Device By Favormates"... it's the perfect match. Good enough for Netflix usage (on FullHD, not suitable for 4K), casual browsing, Spotify and 8 bit and 16 bit systems Emulators. Bought a year ago (December 2016), it's still the best option for 130 bucks and the use I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for media playback
customer_reviews.text: The Intel Compute Stick CS125 just doesn't cut it for media playback. The competition seems to outdo it. Media does not play smoothly above 24 - 30 FPS at 1080p. I can't get this to hit 60 FPS. Forget 4K playback. Even the Windows 10 desktop doesn't run smoothly. The device's fan runs constantly. The included HDMI extender cable is way too short for TV mounts that fit flush against the wall. Don't bother getting this for media playback. I could see this being used as, say, an x86 Raspberry Pi. But don't bother using this for media playback. You will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: StaticDynamics

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome compute stick
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome compute stick. I wanted a computer on my workbench but I didn't have the room. I mounted an old 32" 1080P TV to the wall and plugged this into the HDMI port. I then bought a Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse combo. this is perfect for my needs an came with Windows 10. If has Wi-Fi built in and connected to the network right away. If I had known I probably would have gone with Bluetooth keyboard and mouse and saved myself one of the USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, I bought it to watch my surveillance ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, I bought it to watch my surveillance cameras from my synology NAS on the TV, don't have enough horsepower to use all features I use on my desktop or laptop talking about the Surveillance Station program from Synology, but at least I can watch the whole set of my 6 cameras all at once, can't watch them individually on full screen the compute stick just freeze, the fan start to work at full speed :), if you have used the program you know what I'm talking about, but I missed to read on synology website the hardware requirements, so I can't blame the compute stick, for the rest, youtube, Netflix, web browsing, kodi all works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Great little device, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This is so great. I added the wireless keyboard/trackpad, a 32 GB low profile USB drive, a 4GB SD card with my music on it and a travel USB hub to connect a set of headphones, and other peripherals. It's perfect for school, and doesn't cost a lot. The version of Windows is very bloated with a lot of extra things I disabled (candy crush EVERYTHING!) and didn't want. It comes with 32 GB onboard storage which is plenty, but I remapped all of the folders to the USB drive, It's great. I am very happy with this purchase. I'm only doing spreadsheets and word processing and some streaming and the resources are handling everything I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jael

customer_reviews.title: A pocket computer, lacking some power
customer_reviews.text: If you understand what you are buying, this is as good as you can hope for and at a good price. You get Windows 10 in a "computer" that you can put in your pocket and use with any screen that has an HDMI port. If you need to do anything with a lot of processing power (e.g. games, photo/video editing, video streaming) this is not your best choice. Mine lags sometimes but it recovers after a second and has not crashed yet. As long as you do not expect to have the power of a desktop, you should be happy. It is ideal for lightweight web browsing and Office programs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Be Wary of Auto-Win10 Updates
customer_reviews.text: Quaint little device which I thought would be good for business on the go. Had no problems with it and was actually impressed with its performance until it crashed. I think a large Win10 auto-update was the culprit. Turned off during install and never worked again. Got a free replacement from Intel but I had to pay shipping. I've never used the replacement since it arrived. I instead bought an Intel NUC 6 core i7 KYK which I have zero complaints about at the moment. Certainly not the same price zone as this device, but worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great little computer. I had some trouble with attaching it to a vintage 19" Vizio HD flat screen....it was perhaps 7 or so years old. It works OK, but the resolution adjustment would not match that of the TV...therefore resulting in cutoff of the screen and menus. It worked like a charm on a newer TV, however, so I cannot fault the stick. If you want to watch all of the great content that is al over the internet, you can pretty much skip the "smart" features of your TV and use one of these....it's vastly superior. Make sure you get a nice wireless keyboard....I'd recommend the Logitech K400.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Works well for how small it is!
customer_reviews.text: Works great to stream media off of my NAS server and to do HULU, Netflix, DirecTV streams and such. It can get choppy when streaming HD content for periods of time and sitting 10ft away you can BARELY hear the fan when it kicks on. I took away a star as if you do not use it for a few days up to a week it will just go black screen. Won't turn back on until you unplug the power source and then plug back in. Other than that, if you use it every couple of days it's amazing and better than any Roku or AppleTV for streaming content. Just get a nice keyboard with built-in mouse and you're golden!
customer_reviews.author: Lasabar

customer_reviews.title: OK until last windows update which rendered WiFi inoperable
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about 6 months until last Windows 10 update. Now windows won't recognize the Intel wireless radio contained inside, giving driver problems. In effect makes this useless, as it's rolled back to literally the WINDOWS 95 network configurator as it tries to find any network. Tried restoring Windows, then tried resetting machine to factory fresh and no luck anymore getting windows to detect the Intel wireless radio. Really very little excuse for a windows update bricking an Intel device in 2017. Also if you intend to use this as an entertainment/home media device, it falls short power wise. Expect some stuttering with even H.264 1080p films.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hme media device!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little work machine for school work/workstation tasks can even play some retro games on steam and watch full 1080p videos with little to no buffer depending I am assuming on internet is all. wold recommend only little downer is when it gets up there in temp the little fan gets kinda this annoying ringing sound but behind a tv with volume on at a moderate level you wont here it at all.For under a hundred bucks this is an awesome media machine.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Failed After Two Months
customer_reviews.text: Very cool little computer. Works great for a tiny machine. Not for everyday computing use, but handy for travel and backup. [UPDATE] After only two months, this stick is worthless. It is constantly freezing, crashing, and rebooting. Can't even keep it running for a few hours. Was really liking it, but it didn't last at all. I also now can't return it or get support because it only has 30-days. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Hon. Scott H. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price - Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's not going to replace your work PC. With that said, we have purchased a couple of these to run stat/informational displays. Update to Windows 10 Pro, add it to the domain and manage remotely. Great Price - Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died within a month of use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased four just to run Microsoft Office and two died within a month. Intel is replacing the two so hoping they will work longer. Returned the other two before opening them as didn't want to take the risk and have to spend time returning to Intel again.
customer_reviews.author: Erica McCready

customer_reviews.title: I believe this and a tablet are the perfect combo. Its a full windows 10 computer while ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a laptop replacement to fill the void between my ipad and laptop. Having got rid of my laptop this does exactly what i need it to. I believe this and a tablet are the perfect combo. Its a full windows 10 computer while not having a ton of processing power it works perfect for simple web browsing and Acting as a hub for my external hard drive to store backups of photos, movies, documents.
customer_reviews.author: Not Your Average Tech Dad

customer_reviews.title: Used, not new
customer_reviews.text: Would have received 5 stars cause it provided the digital signage functionality we wanted. However, this was used. It was locked out by whoever had it last. We had to do a system restore to resolve that issue (which took about a day). Next it had an outdated bluetooth driver that we had to fix using a wired keyboard. When all was fixed, it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: FLHTCUI

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming to a TV.
customer_reviews.text: Great for streaming to a big screen tv. I load them up with Kodi and off to the races. This is my second one I purchased. I prefer the stick over an android streaming box. More versatile as it is also a general purpose computer. Comes with Win10 so cant beat the total cost.
customer_reviews.author: Durel C Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Not great for streaming movies, especially 1080p or better.
customer_reviews.text: Not great for video streaming. Movies look like they glitch every few minutes as though the computer was running out of steam. Since this was my main reason for purchasing the device, i am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T.G.M.

customer_reviews.title: Small form, big impact
customer_reviews.text: I use these as digital signage media players, they are very reliable. They are not loud and don't get too hot to the touch. I love the price of these compute sticks. I had bought a couple of the first gen compute sticks and they were not 5 star worthy, Intel seems to have learned from their first version and made this product even better. Including a USB 3.0 port, when it used to only have one, the fan got better and also so did the wifi, the wifi on the 1st gen was not that great. If you need a mini computer for small projects or just something to plug into a TV, this is a cost effective solution
customer_reviews.author: Silvio

customer_reviews.title: good gadget, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received the display went black after 2 or 3 uses.. I returned it for a replacement, the replacement has been ok, but the micro sd card constantly disappears, the only way to remount the sd card is a reboot.. I've tried reformatting the card in different formats, and it doesn't make a difference.. I'm now past my Amazon return period, so I will just tolerate the issue.. Other than my micro sd slot issue, the device has been ok, it performs lightweight tasks without any issues..
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Graham

customer_reviews.title: Does what i expected
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the RAM size, but it hasn't been a problem. 5G WiFi is reliable. I use it to watch Netflix, Kodi, NHK live streams, check my bank accounts, etc. but definately not gaming on it. I have had it almost 2 years and is still working good. I use with Logitech wireless keyboard, so when I travel no need for laptop. I have even used it on hotel room Tv's with pretty good success.
customer_reviews.author: gatesman13

customer_reviews.title: A complete mini computer in stick form
customer_reviews.text: A welcome addition to my entertainment system. This stick runs Windows 10 flawlessly and lets you do anything a regular PC does. Make sure to this version with the double USB ports which has improved performance and support over the earlier models. Don't go for the simlar stick with just a single USB port as that is much slower.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I use mine as a low-power server to run a Discord bot I wrote in .NET Core. It can also play basic games. I was surprised to find that it can play MTG Arena on low settings. For the price/size, you can't go wrong. It is great as a server, or for use as a HTPC. I can't wait for a few generations of improvement on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dean D.

customer_reviews.title: BEST. PURCHASE. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Can I give this six stars? How about a million? How does this exist and no one else seems to know about it??? This is the best purchase I've made in years. Like maybe in my entire. Life. I'm not exaggerating. For roughly $109 (Black Friday deal) I get a fully functioning computer using a screen I already have? Okay. Stop. Ladies and gentlemen, the future is here. I use this thing several hours every evening for reading, streaming, research, and writing word docs. Perfect. Brilliant. Bingo. OBSESSED.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: and this worked out great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a project to create a digital bulletin board on a large screen, just to run a power slide 24/7, and this worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: Pasukun

customer_reviews.title: Struggles to serve up websites using media-rich content.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for my mother, who likes to browse websites with media-rich streaming content. No matter how much I tried to optimize the browser and o.s., the stick would struggle to serve up the pages. I'm certain it will work for others who plan to use it for light surfing. But if you're planning on browsing heavier websites, I would suggest you look for an alternate solution (such as a MINIX model I ended up using):
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Lenovo Compute Stick that kept crashing. The Lenovo was so underpowered that it couldn't even handle Bluetooth being turned on. The Intel Compute Stick works great and has never crashed.
customer_reviews.author: Erik R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for wall mounted TVs
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff for TV. Movie player and TV steamer. Prime Video and Netflix works well on large TVs (ie 1080xresolution) and makes a great media hub. Hooked up a long multi USB on the side to allow easy access for USB media. Wireless keyboard etc. Does what I need it to. Great for presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Kuyo

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, compact, nice features but cannot play HD videos such as 1080p
customer_reviews.text: Maybe good for pictures or low resolution videos but performance isn't good for what I wanted it for, which is to play 720p and 1080p videos. i wish I would have spent twice as much and got the more powerful version.
customer_reviews.author: TKS

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but Flawed
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty little gadget, but it doesn't work as it should, until you fix it. At first it worked fine, but after the first Windows 10 update, the WiFi went dead. It turns out this is a known problem. If this happens to your Compute Stick, then telephone Intel Customer Service at 916-377-7000. They answer promptly and will email you instructions on how to fix the problem with a driver update. Four stars, it would have been an easy Five except for this problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mini PC!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with this guy! Low power use but the performance is good enough to handle HD streaming video without stuttering and I don't worry about leaving it on all the time. I use it as a jump off point to wake on LAN other PCs at home and to receive EventGhost messages and act accordingly. My own customizable smart hub. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: G. Widener

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be sturdy build. Will be buying more of these in ...
customer_reviews.text: Interesting little computer I attached to a large LCD TV for displaying production schedules in factory environment. Take remote control from an office PC (wish it had the Pro OS version for RDP) and update the screen. Appears to be sturdy build. Will be buying more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Data Pro

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This added a lot of functionality to my tv. Surprising that it's a fully functional Windows computer in such a small package. I added a camera and turned my living room tv into a video conferencing machine. It also eliminates the need for anything like chromecast or fire sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected. Can support 4K resolution. Not sure if it can stream 4k video though. It was easy to booth up. Runs pretty quiet, quieter than older versions of the compute stick. For the price it is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: AbeU

customer_reviews.title: Great Computer/Emulator/Media player!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I suggest getting the sandisk extreme( very fast micro sd card) 32 or 64gb cards to go with it, and customize the settings to where everything will save to the sd card. good for browsing web, light gaming, great for emulating classic games all the way up to the psp. It's also great for sling TV , Hulu, Netflix, etc. Just hook up to your tv connect a wireless keyboard with touch pad and your ready to go! it has a fan so it doesn't get to hot and slow down which is a plus. Would recommend this to everyone! don't buy and apple TV! buy a full windows computer for your tv!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great for Magic Jack
customer_reviews.text: My purpose for the Compute Stick was to host my Magic Jack VOIP phone dongle. I *was* using a Win XP desktop for it but that meant leaving it running 24/7. I wanted to move the MJ to a small-form computer. The Raspberry PI came to mind but that meant buying the PI and buying and installing an OS that would run the MJ. I realize that the Compute Stick is probably overkill for what I'm using for but it is inexpensive, comes with Win 10 already loaded, and works right out of the box. I plugged in the MJ dongle, ran an update for it and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: -Kevin N.

customer_reviews.title: Intel Compute Stick is great for general PC use
customer_reviews.text: A great piece of technology for email, surfing, etc. Cannot beat the price especially if you already have a TV or monitor with a HDMI port and get a wireless mouse and keyboard to go with the Compute Stick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: Nearly impossible to setup and configure. Good idea, poorly implemented. Also needs a keyboard and mouse to even try to configure. I never got this working and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Little but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fascinated with this device. I Was looking for a small computer that can use as a Media Center to play my media and steam content... well this overpass my expectations. Certainly you can’t use it to model in 3D or similar heavy tasks, but if you have the same idea that me, well this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: It Costs A Little More Because It Works
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought an off brand computer stick which would not boot. I returned that and bought this for a bit more money. The Intel computer stick just works like it is supposed to. I put in a 128GB micro sd card and picked up a $20 wireless keyboard with touchpad and now I have a good Win 10 PC in my TV.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wiz

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing!!!! it is a great value for the money. Contains a complete CPU with Windows 10 installed. NOTICE: there is no hard drive! It is not intended for that type of application. But this is a great feed for 4K flat screen monitors that are intended to bring internet shows into your home.
customer_reviews.author: James Bean

customer_reviews.title: Temper your expectations
customer_reviews.text: Not stable enough to even pinch hit for your desktop or laptop. First use was evaluating Win10 baked in compared to my laptop upgrade which never satisfied me. Consistently finds inconvenient times to drop out, even after taking steps to counteract it running a bit warmer than perhaps ideal. It's down to being my web surfing tool for my smart TV. Streaming content is not an option. Limited connectivity with effectively one port.
customer_reviews.author: Big Yorty

customer_reviews.title: WiFi stopped working in a day, making the unit useless.
customer_reviews.text: One day after setting it up, the WiFi adapter stopped working rendering this useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: It works GREAT.
customer_reviews.text: I use it instead of the TV boxes. I upgraded to Win 10 pro ( it comes with Win 10 Home). I connect with the onboard WIFI to my network. I can record shows from online TV shows in the US and overseas. It works GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Voith

customer_reviews.title: If you don't want lag here and there watching videos on YouTube and stuff look somewhere else
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far, I've been using it for a couple days now, the only real complaint is YouTube, videos lag a bit, idk about other videos though I've only tried YouTube everything else is good, fast for browsing web normally
customer_reviews.author: Imanol Mateo

customer_reviews.title: Don't go crazy and you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a FireStick/Roku on steroids since you can easily stream, run an internet browser under reasonable load, and run Office software without leaving anything to be desired as far as performance. I found it incredibly helpful to purchase a mini, wireless, rechargeable, 2-in-1 keyboard/trackpad. Now I can fit a whole Windows machine in my pocket when I travel as long as my destination has an HDMI TV.
customer_reviews.author: It made me choose a name

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, works perfect for what I want, I didn't want a laptop due to already having multiple monitors, plus I like it how small it is!! Most places already have monitor or TV anyways You are able to play games on it but the graphic won't be good, you will most likely play on minimum settings
customer_reviews.author: alex phillips

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 and they worked for a day or so, and then they stopped working. Is there any option for a store credit or return after the return date? We would be interested in returning these defective products.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B. Olson, DC

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, I have left it plugged into a TV powered it over weeks (more than 5) and it only rebooted once for updates.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Fregoso

customer_reviews.title: As a media player, web surfing,
customer_reviews.text: As a media player , web surfing, you tube watching mini pc the compute stick is quite capable with a little bit of word and excel to sweeten the pot and also some light emulators
customer_reviews.author: Deirkson Maduro

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice little computer
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little computer. I use it with a 27 inch monitor. I have a Bluetooth mouse and keyboard. I augmented theme or with a high speed USB memory stick. I have Office 2016 loaded. I use it for word processing and working online. I carry the stick with me while traveling. I can plug it into a TV if needed. Great computer for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: A Swank

customer_reviews.title: Re: BOXSTK1A32SC
customer_reviews.text: Can render graphics 1080p x 1920 at 60 Hz. But, you can buy a Compute Stick BOXSTK1A32SC without Windows. It would be by $6.00 cheaper. I think $6.00 for Windows 10 Home 32 bit is too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: R-2

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the future.
customer_reviews.text: If you're an adult like me who just needs a PC for work and light play, this is perfect. It small, quiet and uses hardly any power. Minor issues with Wifi when using the USB 3.0 port to power an SSD - I guess I need a powered hub. Minor issue with Wifi after Windows ran through some updates. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: emcChicago

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it worked
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it worked fine however I had problems when image wouldn't appear on my tv. I would have to reboot. Then it started happening even when it was connected already.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This micro computer is incredible. Should have bought this along time ago. Would recommend to anyone as a general computer. Quick boot up.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: From 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: It frequently stops/freezes so I have to restart it every 2 hrs and booting takes forever. I'm guessing it's the heat problem it's having.
customer_reviews.author: Ho Sook H.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is not a bad little device. It's quick enough to run media apps with ease and doesn't get too hot. I think the price is on point with the features, no problems yet but I'll return to list any that I run into.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Had it for a few months now and i love it
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first because of the specs but shockingly enough, I can stream YouTube videos and Netflix shows with no buffering or lagging. No issues with the initial set up and it's easy to hide behind the tv using a Velcro strip. Highly recommend if you're looking for something basic at a good price for web surfing, playing music and streaming shows.
customer_reviews.author: MDOT

customer_reviews.title: Full windows computer in what amounts to a flash drive
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a real estate office so they could have full windows on their board room tv. Couldn’t believe how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: CphpTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Love the product but...
customer_reviews.text: Got it to play videos on my store tv at 1080p. After 20 mins the stick overheats and starts working extremely slow. Solved this issue by adding 1x1 inch fan on the top of air intake vent. It costed me $5 on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Zh

customer_reviews.title: My first unit failed to load Windows and just kept ...
customer_reviews.text: My first unit failed to load Windows and just kept rebooting. I have just received a replacement and this unit also doesn't load Windows either. The first photo attached shows the error KMODE-EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED (KS.SYS) after a couple of reboots I get the second screen which invites me to repair or continue restarting. This load problem occurs with nothing except the power supply and a TV connected to the unit. I've tried with a wireless mouse and keyboard but that produces the same error. I will wait for any comments on this review before returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Holden

customer_reviews.title: Neat little PC
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, I use it to watch movies and also monitor our security system when I am in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the $119 price. Plug it into my tv hdmi, plug the power cord in, and it practically sets itself up. 32GB storage may not be sufficient so I purchased a WD 1TB portable hard drive for documents and media. It's definitely a bit slower than a standard desktop but I'd say it exceeds what you can expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: We use this for our Church and it works great for the purpose of being able to play services ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our Church and it works great for the purpose of being able to play services and sermons we have downloaded when we have no live pastor. Plus, since it stays hooked up to the big TV, there is no worry about dragging around another piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: maccmom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Slow and has USB connectivity problems. sometimes it connects and other times it does not using the same USB stick. If I get the chance to go back in time, I go for the newer models.
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: looks great been running for 3 months straight now
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a small menu board at a restaurant with it. Running powerpoint slides on a 1080 screen. looks great been running for 3 months straight now.
customer_reviews.author: Normal Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cool tiny computer in a stick!
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a cool small computer! Can get very hot to the touch. Very cool to stream games from xbox one or watch netflix but the only way to watch youtube is to use microsoft edge or internet explorer because google chrome takes up too much memory !
customer_reviews.author: Julia P.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty much what I've expected. This Compute Stick is connected to my tv. I use for web surfing, watching movies, email, word processing and etc. There's going to be minor lags. Obviously don't expect to do any modern gaming. This isn't for that. Anyway, I am glad that I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Tae

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and can handle everyday tasks like Youtube, Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and can handle everyday tasks like Youtube, Netflix, typing, etc. and also some light gaming like Minecraft (at rendering 8 chunks) and Roblox Jailbreak at 3 to last graphics settings and other ungraphically demanding games. This is the best for use as a backup PC or as smart TV. This was easy to setup and fast compared to other pieces of hardware that are advertised to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: B. C.

customer_reviews.title: somewhat slow, and there are occasional errors after each ...
customer_reviews.text: somewhat slow, and there are occasional errors after each install of the drivers or windows updates which seem to be coming from some Intel customizations (not from windows itself, or from drivers), but overall it works OK to RDP to another system.
customer_reviews.author: Kirill B.

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky to get setup right, and slow ...
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to get setup right, and slow. But worked for what we were using it for, and wasn't too far below what we were expecting for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BJ K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Great mediapc/lobby display PC. If you use it for it's intended purpose it's great. Don't expect desktop quality from this. It's a portable machine and performs as such. Great for what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: A reliable option
customer_reviews.text: The unit works flawlessly. I purchased this compute stick to replace a Lenovo Ideacentre 300 that failed after 4 months. (Lenovo only offers a 3 month warranty) I bought the unit to watch Netflix and CraveTV. I have tested the unit running Powerpoint slide shows and it worked well. I am very happy with the quality of the Intel compute stick.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Buhrs

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed, quite surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I don't game on the computer, but for everyday stuff & most importantly word processing, I think this one will do fine. Amazing having a functional crumpet computer in such a small package. I don't use it all the time either, so my opinion may vary slightly compared to a heavy user.
customer_reviews.author: Christy a.

customer_reviews.title: it does what it says
customer_reviews.text: installation and Windows 10 worked intuitive , i downloaded and installed office power point viewer for free. and now i can flip the screen vertical , use a cheap tv and wall poster display and play slides shows all day. saved a lot of money
customer_reviews.author: Andreas F.

customer_reviews.title: I needed it to stream from a server and it worked just like a full desktop
customer_reviews.text: Worked FLAWLESS, just as adverised. I needed it to stream from a server and it worked just like a full desktop! Great product! Attached a wireless keyboard/mouse combo and it was so cool to have a full system in a small size! (Minor issue was that it sometimes does not stay in the HDMI socket as it sticks out past the edge of the TV and gets bumped. Might be better as a small box with a longer cable to the HDMI socket!) Will buy another if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Charline Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good value for streaming
customer_reviews.text: Good value for streaming, and it is nice that it came with Windows 10 pre-loaded. I am not sure what will need to be done if I ever have to re-install or upgrade the OS, since there was nothing in the shipment to address these possibilities. I would suggest upgrading to a non-Atom processor if you intend to do anything more than streaming, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs Windows 10 Home. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This will not replace a desktop machine but it is not intended for that purpose. My use was for displaying a security camera on a small wall mounted TV. works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L

customer_reviews.title: No good for 4K streaming.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Price. Con: Too slow and underpowered for the 4K streaming to your flatscreen that the description promises. If that is your plan, forget this stick and buy the one for almost three times more which WILL work.
customer_reviews.author: lefttune

customer_reviews.title: Some good some bad
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 4 of these since January 2019 and 2 have went bad. I use these for my electronic whiteboards and one completely died and the other will not stop turning off. Even though I have been through the settings multiple times. The ones that are still working - so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby C. Duey

customer_reviews.title: Compute Stick 2nd generation
customer_reviews.text: Compute Stick 2nd generation works very well. Had a little problem getting the display to look OK on the 55 inch TV, but once I selected the right settings on the TV everything looks and works fine. I also bought a Logitech K400 Plus wireless keyboard to use with the Compute Stick, and it is a perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: Halcyon

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Streams online media just like a Roku or F Amazon Fire Stick
customer_reviews.author: jkl

product_meta.title: Intel STK1AW32SC Compute Stick (Black) - (Intel Atom x5-Z8300 1.44 GHz, 2 GB RAM, 32 GB eMMC, Intel HD Graphics, Windows 10)
product_meta.description:
Intel Compute Stick STK1AW32SC - Stick - 1 x Atom x5 Z8300 / 1.44 GHz - RAM 2 GB - flash - eMMC 32 GB - HD Graphics - WLAN : Bluetooth 4.0, 802.11a/b/g/n/ac - Win 10 Home 32-bit - pre-installed: Win 10 Home 32-bit - Monitor : none. The Intel Compute Stick is a tiny device the size of a pack of gum that can transform any HDMI TV or display into a complete computer. Available with a range of Intel processors, it’s everything you love about a desktop computer in a device that fits in the palm of your hand. Portability and Power. A Intel Compute Stick powered by the Intel Core M processor offers the flexibility of having the power of a PC in a device that fits in your shirt pocket. Built for Performance. While the Intel Compute Stick is small in stature, it's what’s inside that makes the biggest difference: a choice of Intel Atom or Core M processors with up to 4 GB memory and 64 GB of on-board storage. Sized for Convenience. It's not like a computer. It is a computer. Same operating system, same high quality graphics, and same wireless connectivity as a full-sized computer. Totally different dimensions. Ready Out Of the Box. Pop it out of the box. Pop it into your TV. Go. It’s that easy to transform any HDMI* TV or monitor into a computer. Cool Under Pressure. Who wants to pay for a processor and not get all the performance? The Intel Compute Stick features a tiny, quiet cooling fan inside to enable reliable and fast performance without overheating.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x Intel Compute Stick STK1AW32SC - Stick - Monitor : none

See more
